textBeforeTable: Hardware Supported Platforms Draw beads Rigid walls CAD surfaces Tied surfaces Eroding contact Edge-to-edge contact Rigid body to rigid body contact Flexible body to rigid body contact Flexible body contact LS-DYNA's contact algorithms include: Contact Algorithms Thick Shells (8-node) SPH Elements Solids (4 and 10-node tetrahedrons, 6-node pentahedrons, and 8-node hexahedrons) (with over 20 solid element formulations) Shells (3, 4, 6, and 8-node including 3D shells, membranes, 2D plane stress, plane strain, and axisymmetric solids) (with over 25 shell element formulations) Sliprings Retractors Pretensioners Seatbelts Sensors Accelerometers Lumped masses Lumped inertias Discrete Elements (springs and dampers) Beams (standard, trusses, discrete, cables, and welds) (with over 10 beam element formulations) LS-DYNA's element library includes: Element Library User-defined materials Viscous fluids Concrete & soils Honeycombs Elastomers Fabrics Foams Glass Plastics Metals LS-DYNA's material library includes: Material Library EM (Electromagnetism) Radiation transport EFG (Element Free Galerkin) SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) Adaptive remeshing Structural-thermal coupling Multi-physics coupling Implicit springback Real-time acoustics Crack propagation Failure analysis Underwater shock FEM-rigid multi-body dynamics coupling (MADYMO, Cal3D) Compressible fluid solver, CESE (Conservation Element & Solution Element) Navier-Stokes fluids FSI (Fluid-Structure Interaction) ALE (Arbitrary Lagrangian-Eulerian) Eulerian capabilities Fluid analysis Thermal analysis Linear statics Normal modes Quasi-static simulations Rigid body dynamics Nonlinear dynamics Full 2D & 3D capabilities LS-DYNA's analysis capabilities include: Capabilities There are many third party software products available for preprocessing LS-DYNA input files. LSTC also develops its own preprocessor, LS-PrePost, which
